add-on with testcase in options (max field)

Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b11pre) Gecko/20110201 Firefox/4.0b11pre

<textbox type="number"> compares input to set minimum while typing, so it gets difficult to put in some special numbers.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Have a textbox with minimum 10.
2. Click into it, press ctrl + a (shouldn't the number be automatically selected?)
3. Try to type 15.

Actual result: After typing the "1", 10 is put into the box and the course behing the 0, so you get 105.

Expected result: Check the value against minimum and maximum onblur, not oninput.

Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b11pre) Gecko/20110201 Firefox/4.0b11pre

<textbox type="number"> compares input to set minimum while typing, so it gets difficult to put in some special numbers.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Have a textbox with minimum 10.
2. Click into it, press ctrl + a (shouldn't the number be automatically selected?)
3. Try to type 15.

Actual result: After typing the "1", 10 is put into the box and the course behing the 0, so you get 105.

Expected result: Check the value against minimum and maximum onblur, not oninput.

comments.text: This makes it impossible to type in some numbers without selecting parts of the preset/set minimum. Typing the first number with minimum 10 will always set the value to 10, so you have to select the "0" and type the last number and then the "1" and the second last number.
